title: Orientation & Introduction
description: Introduction to the Federal Candidate Simulator and how it works.
readingSummary: Welcome to the Federal Candidate Simulator — AI Edition. This simulator will take you through the entire election cycle, one step at a time. You’ll experience filing, fundraising, compliance, and campaigning — all safely in a simulation.
Candidate Coins (CC) represent your campaign energy and credibility. You start with 50 CC, which can be spent or earned depending on your decisions.
Signatures and voter approval reflect your public support. 100 signatures = 1% voter approval.
You must choose an office: President (75 CC + 2.5% approval), Senate (50 CC + 2.5%), or House (31 CC + 2.5%).

tasks.prompt: What do Candidate Coins (CC) represent in this simulator?

questions.question: Select the correct answer:
options: B) Real currency for campaign ads

purpose: Introduce users to simulator mechanics, CC, signatures, approval, and office selection.
outcome: User chooses an office and understands the rules for CC, signatures, approval, and tasks.
